pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.8: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see {MS.3.1595}. | According to [](MS.3.1680) this means not smaller than 8 by 4 _sugataṅgula_, or 40 by 20 cm based on my calculation of the _sugataṅgula_, “the standard fingerbreadth”, as 5 cm. For further explanation, see comment at _bhikkhu-saṅghādisesa_ 6.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.18: _Khajjaka_ . According to {Sp.4.893.16} (commenting on the _sekhiya_ rules) this refers to all non-staple foods: _ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṃ gahetabbaṃ_ , “Here the non-staple foods which are roots, etc. may all be taken.”
